project_abstract.cdata: The project is intended to address many of the basic issues now facing Korean agriculture including the need to increase (i) production of high-value fruits and vegetables, (ii) farm productivity, and (iii) off-season employment. Over a four-year period, the project would provide credit for a wide range of activities, notably: greenhouses, sprinkler irrigation, on-farm storage, chilled storage, spraying equipment, small-scale agroprocessing, and backyard livestock. The project activities would cover the whole country and directly benefit about 13,700 farmers and 124 cooperatives.
